BackLVSeatedHighRowC.name: Lever Seated High Row
BackLVSeatedHighRowC.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
BackLVSeatedHighRowC.execution: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackLVSeatedHighRowC.comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. Also see Hammer Equipment Lever Seated High Row, Selectorized and Plate loaded versions.
BackLVSeatedHighRowC.synergists: latissimusdorsi, infraspinatus, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

BackLVAlternatingSeatedHighRow.name: Lever Alternating Seated High Row
BackLVAlternatingSeatedHighRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
BackLVAlternatingSeatedHighRow.execution: Pull one lever handle back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
BackLVAlternatingSeatedHighRow.comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.
BackLVAlternatingSeatedHighRow.synergists: latissimusdorsi, infraspinatus, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

BackLVSeatedHighRowB.name: Lever Seated High Row
BackLVSeatedHighRowB.preparation: Sit on seat and position thighs under pad. Lean forward and grasp lever handles above.
BackLVSeatedHighRowB.execution: Pull lever down while leaning back slightly. As elbows travel to sides, lift chest slightly and pull shoulders and elbows back. Return until arms are extended and body and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackLVSeatedHighRowB.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow for full range of motion. Also see Lever Seated Hammer High Row.
BackLVSeatedHighRowB.synergists: latissimusdorsi, infraspinatus, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, erectorspinae, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

BackLVSeatedRow.name: Lever Seated Row
BackLVSeatedRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Push foot lever if available. Grasp narrower parallel grip handles.
BackLVSeatedRow.execution: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackLVSeatedRow.comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.
BackLVSeatedRow.synergists: latissimusdorsi, infraspinatus, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

BackLVWideGripSeatedRow.name: Lever Wide Grip Seated Row
BackLVWideGripSeatedRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp outer lever handles with overhand grip.
BackLVWideGripSeatedRow.execution: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackLVWideGripSeatedRow.comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.
BackLVWideGripSeatedRow.synergists: latissimusdorsi, infraspinatus, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

BackLVSeatedRowNoPad.name: Lever Seated Row (no chest pad)
BackLVSeatedRowNoPad.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles with each hand. Place feet on vertically angled platform. Slide hips back with knees slightly bent.
BackLVSeatedRowNoPad.execution: Pull handles to waist while straightening torso upright. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
BackLVSeatedRowNoPad.comments: Exercise is performed on apparatus with no chest pad, in contrast to standard lever seated row machine. This exercise is more similar to Cable Seated Row. Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion through lower back will vary from person to person. For even greater hip and low back articulation, hips may be slid back further with knees straighter. See Cable Seated Row Questionand Dangerous Exercise Essay.Also see Lever Straight Back Seated Row (no chest pad).
BackLVSeatedRowNoPad.synergists: latissimusdorsi, infraspinatus, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, erectorspinae, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

BackLVStraightBackSeatedRowNoPad.name: Lever Straight Back Seated Row (no chest pad)
BackLVStraightBackSeatedRowNoPad.preparation: Sit on seat with feet positioned on foot bar or platform. Grasp handles with each hand. Position torso upright with knees bent slightly.
BackLVStraightBackSeatedRowNoPad.execution: Pull handles to body. Pull shoulders back and lift chest by arching back. Return until arms are extended, back is straight, and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackLVStraightBackSeatedRowNoPad.comments: Exercise is performed on apparatus with no chest pad, in contrast to standard lever seated row machine. This exercise is more similar to Cable Straight Back Seated Row. Exercise may also be performed with greater low back involvement see Lever Seated Row (no chest pad).
BackLVStraightBackSeatedRowNoPad.synergists: latissimusdorsi, infraspinatus, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

BackLVSeatedUnderhandRowS.name: Lever Underhand Seated Row
BackLVSeatedUnderhandRowS.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
BackLVSeatedUnderhandRowS.execution: Pull lever handles back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackLVSeatedUnderhandRowS.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.
BackLVSeatedUnderhandRowS.synergists: latissimusdorsi, infraspinatus, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

BackLVSeatedUnderhandRow.name: Lever Underhand Seated Row
BackLVSeatedUnderhandRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
BackLVSeatedUnderhandRow.execution: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackLVSeatedUnderhandRow.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.
BackLVSeatedUnderhandRow.synergists: latissimusdorsi, infraspinatus, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids

BackLVAlternatingSeatedUnderhandRow.name: Lever Alternating Underhand Seated Row
BackLVAlternatingSeatedUnderhandRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
BackLVAlternatingSeatedUnderhandRow.execution: Pull one lever handle back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
BackLVAlternatingSeatedUnderhandRow.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.
BackLVAlternatingSeatedUnderhandRow.synergists: latissimusdorsi, infraspinatus, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, teresminor, rhomboids
